creditline: Bequest of Mary Griggs Burke and gift of Eleanor Briggs
description: abstract landscape-like imagery; grey, black, and dark pink rolling forms with scalloped cloud-like shapes in foreground
image_copyright: © Georgia O%27Keeffe Museum %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
text: Georgia O’Keeffe was one of the most admired American Modernist painters of the 20th century. Black Place I is unquestionably one of her finest landscapes and represents the crucial period of O’Keeffe’s maturation as a painter and her rise to national prominence. It also offers a brilliant pendant to The Destroyer by her first teacher Arthur Wesley Dow.
title: Black Place I
